intro: Aeschynomene pudica, commonly known as smallleaf aeschynomene, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, trifoliate leaves and yellow flowers. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in poor nutrient conditions. It has a shallow root system and is known for its ability to fix nitrogen, making it useful in soil enrichment. Aeschynomene pudica is also used in traditional medicine and as a forage crop in some parts of the world.
